ticket.title: Failed to start a rails application
ticket.original-body:
rails server fails to start the application
=> Booting WEBrick => Rails 3.0.0.beta1 application starting in development on http://0.0.0.0:3000 => Call with -d to detach => Ctrl-C to shutdown server Exiting /home/hemant/.bundle/ruby/1.9.1/bundler/gems/rails-16a5e918a06649ffac24fd5873b875daf66212ad-master/railties/lib/rails/railtie/configuration.rb:86:in `method_missing': undefined local variable or method `metals' for #<Rails::Engine::Configuration:0x00000015081de8> (NameError) from /home/hemant/.bundle/ruby/1.9.1/bundler/gems/rails-16a5e918a06649ffac24fd5873b875daf66212ad-master/railties/lib/rails/railtie/configuration.rb:121:in `block (2 levels) in default_middleware' from version.title: Failed to start a rails application
Failed to start a rails application

version.body: And this commit might be the cause: http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/29158d4158e9ae800c5be31a796940888bd03cc5
version.body-html: And this commit might be the cause: http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/29158d4158e9ae800c5be31a796940...
version.title: Failed to start a rails application

version.body:
Hemant: do you use warden/devise in your application? That might be the underlying issue. Devise is currently not compatible with edge Rails.
http://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues#issue/142
version.body-html:
Hemant: do you use warden/devise in your application? That might be the underlying issue. Devise is currently not compatible with edge Rails.

http://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues#issue/142
version.title: Failed to start a rails application

version.body: yes i think that is the problem there.
version.body-html: yes i think that is the problem there.
version.title: Failed to start a rails application

version.body: sorry guys i should i have investigated more before posting this ticket. Yes Devise is the cause of failure of starting up the application there on edge.
version.body-html: sorry guys i should i have investigated more before posting this ticket. Yes Devise is the cause of failure of starting up the application there on edge.
version.title: Failed to start a rails application
Failed to start a rails application

version.body:
I had the same Hemant as I was bundling to rails source. Making this change in my Gemfile fixed things right up:
gem 'rails', '3.0.0.beta'
Devise seems to be working just fine with that release.
HTH
version.body-html:
I had the same Hemant as I was bundling to rails source. Making this change in my Gemfile fixed things right up:

gem 'rails', '3.0.0.beta'

Devise seems to be working just fine with that release.

HTH
